features.title: Why use Avifkit?
features.subtitle: The modern standard for image conversion.
features.privacy_desc: Unlike other tools, Avifkit processes images locally using your browser's engine. Your photos are never sent to a cloud server.
features.speed_desc: Zero upload time. Zero download wait. We use advanced WebAssembly and Canvas APIs to convert files instantly.
features.quality_desc: Control compression levels and preserve transparency (alpha channel) when converting AVIF to PNG or WebP.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.a1: Generally, AVIF offers better compression efficiency (smaller file sizes) than WebP for the same visual quality. However, WebP currently has slightly broader browser support.
faq.q2: Can I open WebP on iPhone?
faq.a2: Yes, modern iOS versions (iOS 14+) support WebP natively. If you have an older iPhone, converting to JPG is recommended.
faq.q3: Is it safe to convert private photos here?
faq.a3: Absolutely. Avifkit uses client-side processing technology. Your images are converted directly within your web browser memory and are never uploaded to any external server.
faq.a4: Yes! If you convert AVIF to PNG or WebP, the transparent background (alpha channel) is preserved. If you convert to JPG, transparent areas will become white.
faq.q5: How do I open AVIF on Windows 10?
faq.a5: Windows 10 and 11 support AVIF if you install the 'AV1 Video Extension'. Alternatively, use Avifkit to convert them to standard JPGs.

content.lead: Windows giving you a black screen or "Can't open this file" error when trying to view AVIF images? The fastest fix is converting them to JPG. Takes 2 seconds, free, no installation required.

sections.heading: Method 1: Convert AVIF to JPG Online (Recommended)
paragraphs: This is honestly the easiest way. You don't install anything, you don't mess with Windows settings, and it works every single time.

subsections.heading: Why this works better:
list: Processes files locally in your browser (secure)

subsections.heading: Step-by-step:
orderedList: Go to AvifKit AVIF to JPG Converter
Drag your AVIF file into the browser window
Open it normally in Windows Photos or any app

sections.conclusion: That's it. The converted JPG file will open in any Windows app - Photos, Paint, Photoshop, you name it.

tip.title: Pro tip for batch conversion:
tip.content: You can drag multiple AVIF files at once. AvifKit will convert all of them and package the results in a zip file for easy download.

sections.heading: Method 2: Install the AV1 Video Extension (The Hard Way)
paragraphs: Microsoft does offer an official codec extension, but here's the catch: sometimes it costs $0.99, sometimes it's free, and sometimes it just doesn't work properly (black screen bug).

subsections.heading: If you still want to try it:
orderedList: Open the Microsoft Store app on Windows
Try opening the AVIF file again

subsections.heading: Known issues with this method:
list: Black screen on certain AVIF variants
Doesn't work with 10-bit color depth AVIFs
May cost money depending on your Windows version

sections.conclusion: This is why most people just convert to JPG instead. It's more reliable.

faq.question: Why can't Windows open AVIF files by default?
faq.answer: AVIF is a relatively new image format (released in 2019). Windows 10 and 11 don't have native support built-in yet. Microsoft added partial support via an optional extension, but it's buggy and incomplete.

faq.question: Is AVIF better than JPG?
faq.answer: Technically, yes. AVIF offers about 50% better compression at the same quality level. But compatibility is still terrible. If you need to share images or open them on multiple devices, JPG is safer.

faq.question: Will converting AVIF to JPG lose quality?
faq.answer: Slightly, yes. But unless you're doing professional photo editing, you won't notice the difference. For everyday use (viewing photos, sharing on social media), JPG is perfectly fine.

faq.question: Can I convert AVIF to PNG instead?
faq.answer: Yes, especially if your AVIF file has transparency. JPG doesn't support transparency, but PNG does. Use the AVIF to PNG converter if you need to preserve transparent backgrounds.

content.bottom_line: Converting to JPG online is the safest and fastest method. No installation headaches, no compatibility issues, no random crashes. Just drag, convert, done.
